description:
Cloud-Native and Kubernetes are common buzz words and something most companies are wrestling with.

We're pleased to announce another panel discussion, this time focused on "the future of cloud".

Some of the topics include:

- Multi-cloud - it is important going forward. Being able to run your infrastructure in multiple public/private cloud platforms.

- The end of DevOps Engineers? Abstraction from infrastructure and servers to be generic (like Helm on Kubernetes) will there be a need for DevOps engineers going forward when you can just plug a play entire platform.

- Serverless are we fully committed? What are the benefits what are the misconceptions and reluctances?

- What are the costs of being Cloud Agnostic going forward?

Our panellists are:

Jonathan Shanks - https://www.linkedin.com/in/jonathanshanks/

Dan Evans - https://www.linkedin.com/in/danevans/

Andrew Bold - https://www.linkedin.com/in/andybold/

Roy Lines - https://www.linkedin.com/in/roylines/

The event will be facilitated by Ben Saunders - https://www.linkedin.com/in/ben-saunders-24699558/

If you have any other topics you're keen to hear about please give me a nudge.
title: Future of cloud - a panel discussion
